Title: Principal Software Engineer
Job_Description:
8117 - Dallas Technology Hub - 5830 Granite Parkway, Plano, Texas, 75024

CarMax, the way your career should be!
About this job

At CarMax, we are industry disruptors. At the heart of our innovation is new digital products. Working on many different aspects of the customer experience, our Principal Engineers research and discover new opportunities and shape products to fulfill them. From inception to completion, you will develop tools and technology, learning quickly from our spirit of experimentation. You will have a direct impact on improving the performance of our business and ensuring customers can buy the vehicles they want in a way that is right for them!

Lead development for an industry leader

At CarMax, we want to disrupt our industry by empowering customers to buy a car on their own terms - allowing them to transact with us anytime, anywhere. As a Lead developer, you'll be at the forefront of driving technical innovation alongside several product teams who are creating a seamless online transaction experience for our customers and associates.

Able to balance customer needs with business goals and know how to deliver technical solutions that enhance business value. Creative, curious, and highly analytical, you never stop learning and thrive on constant change in the digital marketplace. From inception to completion, you will develop tools and technology, learning quickly from our spirit of experimentation. Overall, you will have a direct impact on improving the performance of our business and ensuring customers can buy the vehicles they want in a way that's right for them.

A team of experts (such as a Product Manager, Lead Developer, Delivery Manager, Analyst/Data Scientist, and other Software Developers), working in a fast-paced, highly collaborative, and customer-focused environment to bring a seamless online shopping experience to life.

A passionate technology team, developing ground-breaking products. Working collaboratively and creatively as part of a close-knit product team, you will be part of the development process from end to end: consulting users, carrying out experiments, tackling complex business problems and implementing new products.





This role requires hands-on work in technologies such as (Functions, App Services, App Insights, Structured/Unstructured data storage, Redis, and others), , or s for CI/CD edge, load testing / automated testing tools, , and systems.





CarMax disrupted the auto industry by delivering the honest, transparent and high-integrity experience customers want and deserve. This innovative thinking around the way cars are bought and sold has helped us become the nation's largest retailer of used cars, with over 200 locations nationwide.

Our amazing team of more than 25,000 associates work together to deliver iconic customer experiences. Along the way, we help every associate grow their career and achieve their best, at work and in their community. We are recognized for our commitment to training and diversity and are one of the FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For®.



CarMax is committed to bringing together people from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe, welcoming, and inclusive work environment.

CarMax is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, and any other characteristics protected by law.

Upon an applicant's request, CarMax will consider reasonable accommodation to complete the CarMax Job Application.

Upon an applicant's request, CarMax will consider reasonable accommodation to complete the CarMax Job Application.

Title: Principal Software Engineer
Job_Description:
9002 - Carmax Auto Finance - 225 Chastain Meadows Ct NW, Kennesaw, Georgia, 30144

CarMax, the way your career should be!
Play a key role in supporting CarMax Auto Finance

The Analyst II of the Technical and Analytical Support Team provides analytical support for key areas of CarMax Auto Finance (CAF) business. This person provides analytical and technical support for key processes such as securitization and credit bureau reporting. The Analyst II will also provide analytical and technical support to the Financial Accounting team to ensure that our system of record (Alfa) performs as expected as changes and improvements are implemented.

What you will do
Perform analysis on credit bureau reporting strategy and recommend system changes; partner with stakeholders to implement and test changes.



Our company's success is motivated by our customer-centric, data-informed approach to problem solving, with an unparalleled focus on a company culture that supports our associates and our community. As an Analyst II, Technical and Analytical Support, you will have a direct hand in this effort by leveraging your creative, analytical and technical abilities to ensure that key and highly compliant aspects of our business are operating effectively. It takes a tenacious enthusiasm for problem-solving, combined with an inherent passion for doing what's right, to balance the needs of the business and our customers in these endeavors. You will be entrusted to work independently, in an environment that is collaborative, fast-paced, teamwork-centric, and ever-evolving.

Title: Business Office Associate
Job_Description:
Want to join a company with a great culture and opportunities to advance your career? CarMax might be the place for you. CarMax is recognized as one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For with great pay and benefits, a 401k match, car discounts, and paid time off and paid leave.
Job title: Home Delivery Customer Specialist / Business Office Associate
7257 - Brandywine - 7700 Matapeake Business Drive, Brandywine, Maryland, 20613
CarMax, the way your career should be!
General Summary:
Under limited supervision of the Business Office Manager, the Customer Specialist- Alternative Delivery provides exceptional customer service in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment through the completion of sales transactions, while working in multiple environments including both indoors, outdoors, and offsite (“home”) delivery of vehicles. The Customer Specialist- Alternative Delivery will also focus on the facilitation of paperwork and post-sale processing. The Customer Specialist-Alternative Delivery will also perform vehicle condition verifications and prepare the vehicles for delivery.

Title: Sr. Data Scientist
Job_Description:
8116 - Midtown Office - 2220 W. Broad Street, Richmond, Virginia, 23220

CarMax, the way your career should be!
About this job

Over twenty years ago, CarMax disrupted the automotive industry and to this day remains the undisputed market leader in a $500B+ industry. With best-in-class financial performance, customer satisfaction, and associate engagement, CarMax is well positioned for continued growth. With this growth, we strive to maintain our analytics-based competitive advantage through our algorithm driven pricing and inventory systems. To do so, we're currently looking for experienced analysts who are looking to apply their passion for strategic thinking to drive business-critical decisions.

It's an exciting time at CarMax! After decades of success and a rise to becoming the largest used car retailer in the US, CarMax is focused on disrupting the auto industry once again through our transformation to a leading omni-channel retailer. To achieve this goal, CarMax has spent the last few years investing heavily in modernizing our digital and analytical infrastructure to support our customer-centric experience as the customer shopping journey continues to evolve online. We're stitching data science throughout our business to drive a great customer experience and optimize our operations.

As a Sr Data Scientist at CarMax, you'll join a team responsible for building and maintaining sophisticated algorithms and analytic tools that use best-in-industry data collected from millions of consumers as they shopped. These algorithms are used to enhance how Customers navigate their car buying journey, and to optimize Associate impact.





To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.




CarMax disrupted the auto industry by delivering the honest, transparent and high-integrity experience customers want and deserve. This innovative thinking around the way cars are bought and sold has helped us become the nation's largest retailer of used cars, with over 200 locations nationwide.

Our amazing team of more than 25,000 associates work together to deliver iconic customer experiences. Along the way, we help every associate grow their career and achieve their best, at work and in their community. Title: Sr. Data Scientist
Job_Description:
8901 - Corp Office West Crk - 12800 Tuckahoe Creek Parkway, Richmond, Virginia, 23238

CarMax, the way your career should be!
About This Job

The primary responsibility for the Pricing team is to accurately and systematically value each individual car that we buy and sell. Last year, CarMax sold over 1 million vehicles and appraised over 2 million vehicles, and Pricing directed over $20B in spend to purchase inventory. To properly value these vehicles, our data scientists must develop algorithms that best reflect customer preferences for each vehicle's unique characteristics and that effectively respond to constantly changing consumer demand, wholesale auction supply, and other global/local market conditions.

What You Will Do - Essential Responsibilities

1) Develop new models and improve our existing models

2) Help CarMax continue to develop its data expertise

3) Effectively communicate how our models work to team members, both at a general level and a detailed level



CarMax relies on algorithms to make important decisions about which cars to buy, how to price them, and how to allocate them across our 200+ stores. Doing so ensures that we have the right cars at the right prices to meet our customers' needs. As we continue to innovate our business and shift more of our buying and selling online, we increasingly need to make these decisions quickly with less human intervention. Our team of data scientists plays a critical role in unlocking the business value from these innovations.



To be successful for this role, a candidate must demonstrate the ability to consistently deliver at a high level on the responsibilities listed above. A few of the competencies that will position you for success are:

1) Strong modeling skills and a desire to continue to grow those skills

2) Solid foundational math, computer science, and machine learning skills

3) Ability to influence the team's results



CarMax disrupted the auto industry by delivering the honest, transparent and high-integrity experience customers want and deserve. This innovative thinking around the way cars are bought and sold has helped us become the nation's largest retailer of used cars, with over 200 locations nationwide.

Our amazing team of more than 25,000 associates work together to deliver iconic customer experiences. Along the way, we help every associate grow their career and achieve their best, at work and in their community. Title: Sr. Data Scientist
Job_Description:
8901 - Corp Office West Crk - 12800 Tuckahoe Creek Parkway, Richmond, Virginia, 23238

CarMax, the way your career should be!
About This Job

The primary responsibility for the Pricing team is to accurately and systematically value each individual car that we buy and sell. Last year, CarMax sold over 1 million vehicles and appraised over 2 million vehicles, and Pricing directed over $20B in spend to purchase inventory - all while dealing with constantly changing consumer demand, wholesale auction supply, and other global/local market conditions. In order to realize the full value of our pricing models, our systems experts must accurately and instantaneously deliver thousands of recommendations to our field associates daily. This requires the combination of a deep understanding of the models, the technical skill to deploy new models as robust and stable systems, and the results orientation and analytical ability to quickly diagnose and fix problems as they arise.



1) Collaborate with our modeling experts to develop and operationalize new algorithms

2) Own the development and execution of a management system that ensures we put the right value on every vehicle every day

3) Drive CarMax's development of data science expertise

4) Communicate how our systems work throughout the organization, both at a general level and a detailed level



CarMax relies on algorithms to make important decisions about which cars to buy, how to price them, and how to allocate them across our 200+ stores. Doing so ensures that we have the right cars at the right prices to meet our customers' needs. As we continue to innovate our business and shift more of our buying and selling online, we increasingly need to make these decisions quickly with less human intervention. Our team of data scientists plays a critical role in unlocking the business value from these innovations.



To be successful for this role, a candidate must demonstrate the ability to consistently deliver at a high level on the responsibilities listed above. A few of the competencies that will position you for success are:

1) Mathematical, modeling, and reasoning skills to understand complex pricing models and deploy them accurately

2) Strong foundational computer science and data analytic skills

3) Ability to influence the team's results

4) Desire to develop into an effective technical leader and/or people manager

5) Passion for solving technical problems and for engineering solutions that work consistently



CarMax disrupted the auto industry by delivering the honest, transparent and high-integrity experience customers want and deserve. This innovative thinking around the way cars are bought and sold has helped us become the nation's largest retailer of used cars, with over 200 locations nationwide.

Title: Business Analyst Rotation Program - Richmond, VA
Job_Description:
8116 - Midtown Office - 2220 W. Broad Street, Richmond, Virginia, 23220

CarMax, the way your career should be!
Analyst Rotation Program:

Our Analyst Rotation Program (ARP) provides experience in a variety of roles at CarMax giving ample opportunity for recent grads to develop skills in analytics, strategy, communication & influence. Business Analysts get firsthand experience solving unique and complex problems and significantly contribute to company performance right from the start.
ARP is a 2-year program, providing three 8-month rotations with teams across the CarMax analyst community
Analysts in ARP start together as a cohort and share experiences through the duration of the program



Business analysts are the analytical authorities at CarMax.

Analyze

This role enables you to apply your analytical skillset to CarMax's proprietary, industry-leading data and unique business problems. You will help design and optimize strategies at the heart of our business & contribute significantly to our success as we continue to disrupt our industry.

Collaborate & Influence

In ARP, you will work closely with leadership in operations, product, marketing, technology, and other business areas to influence what we do & how we do it. Business Analysts are critical team members in major company initiatives, developing insights that drive our decision making.

Learn & Grow

Rotations enable analysts to learn from real-world experience with a variety of business problems - developing a broad understanding of our business and a diverse network along the way. Formal training ensures analysts have the tools to be successful & a strong understanding of our business. Throughout the program, analysts develop strong technical skills (e.g. coding, analytic methods) & soft skills (communication & storytelling).

Contribute to our Diverse Community

We are proud of our community of more than 200 full-time analysts & 20 analyst interns, from various backgrounds and experiences (including former CarMax interns!). Develop friendships & professional relationships that will enrich your experience at CarMax and contribute to your success going forward.







Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we're all in this together.

CarMax, the way your career should be!

Job Description

About this Job:

Disrupting the marketplace for more than 25 years, CarMax is the largest used car retailer in the US. Our success is a direct result of our customer-centric, data-informed approach to problem solving and an unparalleled focus on a company culture that supports our employees and our community.

As a Business Analyst, you will play a key part in driving our success for the future. This entry-level, 24-month rotational position will provide recent college graduates the opportunity to apply strategic thinking, problem solving, and analytics to unique and complex problems influencing company performance and success from Day 1.



- Business Analysts are the analytical authorities at CarMax. Apply analytical rigor to CarMax's proprietary, industry-leading data to formulate and test theories about specific business areas. Leverage your new insights in combination with advanced analytical techniques to develop insightful metrics and predictive models.

- Business Analysts are key collaborators driving major corporate functions and initiatives and are encouraged to work proactively and independently. They work closely with leadership in field execution, technology, marketing, and other business areas, to inform our strategy and execution. They help CarMax create powerful, compelling narratives and influence corporate decision-making at the most senior levels.

CarMax disrupted the auto industry by delivering the honest, transparent and high-integrity experience customers want and deserve. This innovative thinking around the way cars are bought and sold has helped us become the nation's largest retailer of used cars, with over 200 locations nationwide.
